org.educraft.block.ordering

Class OrderingContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minecraft.inventory.Container
      • org.educraft.block.ordering.OrderingContainer

  • public class OrderingContainer
extends net.minecraft.inventory.Container
    Container used to represent the inventory of an ordering bench. It uses a tile entity to make the inventory available to multiple users.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class net.minecraft.inventory.Container

        crafters, inventoryItemStacks, inventorySlots, windowId

    • Method Detail

      • onCraftMatrixChanged

        public void onCraftMatrixChanged(net.minecraft.inventory.IInventory inventory)
        Called whenever a player adds or removes something from the crafting matrix. Used to update the crafting result.
        Overrides:
        onCraftMatrixChanged in class net.minecraft.inventory.Container
        Parameters:
        inventory - the crafting matrix

      • onContainerClosed

        public void onContainerClosed(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        Called whenever a player closes the GUI. So long as at least one player is using the GUI, we should keep all the items in the crafting matrix. If no one is using it, then we should drop everything, like in a regular crafting bench.
        Overrides:
        onContainerClosed in class net.minecraft.inventory.Container
        Parameters:
        player - the player who just closed the GUI

      • canInteractWith

        public boolean canInteractWith(net.minecraft.entity.player.EntityPlayer player)
        Determines whether the given player is allowed to use this container or not.
        Specified by:
        canInteractWith in class net.minecraft.inventory.Container
        Parameters:
        player - the player attempting to interact
        Returns:
        true if the player is allowed to interact
